title: How to Make Peanut Butter Sheet Cake

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (176°C) and rub vegetable shortening on the bottom and sides of a large jelly roll pan or a rimmed cookie sheet.
Sprinkle about 2 tablespoons of flour over the greased pan.
Pick up the pan and swirl the flour around until it has coated the entire inside of the pan.
Place the butter, water, peanut butter and oil into a medium-size saucepan.
Bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until they are well blended.
Remove the saucepan from the stove and add in the flour, sugar, eggs, vanilla, milk and soda.
Stir the mixture until all the dry ingredients are incorporated and well blended.
Pour the cake batter into your pan and bake it for 12 to 15 minutes.
Test the cake for readiness after 12 minutes.
steps.description: If a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean, the cake is finished baking.

steps.headline: Remove the cake from the oven and set it aside to cool.
Place the butter, milk, peanut butter and vanilla in a saucepan and slowly bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove the pan from the stove and set it on a heatproof surface.
Add the sugar to the mixture.
Stir the ingredients until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Allow the icing to cool to room temperature.
Spread the icing on your cooled cake.

text: Making the Cake Preheat your oven to 350°F (176°C) and rub vegetable shortening on the bottom and sides of a large jelly roll pan or a rimmed cookie sheet.  Sprinkle about 2 tablespoons of flour over the greased pan.  Pick up the pan and swirl the flour around until it has coated the entire inside of the pan.  Discard any excess flour.  Place the butter, water, peanut butter and oil into a medium-size saucepan.  Bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until they are well blended.  Remove the saucepan from the stove and add in the flour, sugar, eggs, vanilla, milk and soda.  Stir the mixture until all the dry ingredients are incorporated and well blended.  Pour the cake batter into your pan and bake it for 12 to 15 minutes.  Test the cake for readiness after 12 minutes. If a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean, the cake is finished baking. Remove the cake from the oven and set it aside to cool.  Making the Icing Place the butter, milk, peanut butter and vanilla in a saucepan and slowly bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.  Remove the pan from the stove and set it on a heatproof surface.  Add the sugar to the mixture.  Stir the ingredients until the sugar is completely dissolved.  Allow the icing to cool to room temperature.  Spread the icing on your cooled cake.  Finished.
